name: Titanium.Media.AudioPlayer
doc:
@platform android 0.9 @platform iphone 0.9 @platform ipad 0.9 @editurl https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/edit/master/apidoc/Titanium/Media/AudioPlayer.yml

An audio player object used for streaming audio to the device, and low-level control of the audio playback.

@description

On Android, when you are done playing a given audio file, you must call the release method to stop buffering audio data and release associated system resources.

On iOS, you can control how the audio stream interacts with other system sounds by setting Titanium.Media.audioSessionMode.

Use the Titanium.Media.createAudioPlayer method to create an audio player.

Examples

Audio Streaming

The following example demonstrates using the AudioPlayer object to stream audio.

var win = Titanium.UI.createWindow({
    title:'Audio Test',
    backgroundColor:'#fff',
    layout: 'vertical'
});

var startStopButton = Titanium.UI.createButton({
    title:'Start/Stop Streaming',
    top:10,
    width:200,
    height:40
});

var pauseResumeButton = Titanium.UI.createButton({
    title:'Pause/Resume Streaming',
    top:10,
    width:200,
    height:40,
    enabled:false
});

win.add(startStopButton);
win.add(pauseResumeButton);

// allowBackground: true on Android allows the
// player to keep playing when the app is in the
// background.
var audioPlayer = Ti.Media.createAudioPlayer({
    url: 'www.example.com/podcast.mp3',
    allowBackground: true
});

startStopButton.addEventListener('click',function() {
    // When paused, playing returns false.
    // If both are false, playback is stopped.
    if (audioPlayer.playing || audioPlayer.paused)
    {
        audioPlayer.stop();
        pauseResumeButton.enabled = false;
        if (Ti.Platform.name === 'android')
        {
            audioPlayer.release();
        }
    }
    else
    {
        audioPlayer.start();
        pauseResumeButton.enabled = true;
    }
});

pauseResumeButton.addEventListener('click', function() {
    if (audioPlayer.paused) {
        audioPlayer.start();
    }
    else {
        audioPlayer.pause();
    }
});

audioPlayer.addEventListener('progress',function(e) {
    Ti.API.info('Time Played: ' + Math.round(e.progress) + ' milliseconds');
});

audioPlayer.addEventListener('change',function(e)
{
    Ti.API.info('State: ' + e.description + ' (' + e.state + ')');
});

win.addEventListener('close',function() {
    audioPlayer.stop();
    if (Ti.Platform.osname === 'android')
    {
        audioPlayer.release();
    }
});

win.open();

property.name: STATE_BUFFERING
property.doc: Audio data is being buffered from the network.

property.name: STATE_INITIALIZED
property.doc: Audio playback is being initialized.

property.name: STATE_PAUSED
property.doc: Playback is paused.

property.name: STATE_PLAYING
property.doc: Audio playback is active.

property.name: STATE_STARTING
property.doc: Audio playback is starting.

property.name: STATE_STOPPED
property.doc: Audio playback is stopped.

property.name: STATE_STOPPING
property.doc: Audio playback is stopping.

property.name: STATE_WAITING_FOR_DATA
property.doc: Player is waiting for audio data from the network.

property.name: STATE_WAITING_FOR_QUEUE
property.doc: Player is waiting for audio data to fill the queue.

property.name: allowBackground
property.doc:
Boolean to indicate if audio should continue playing even if the associated Android Activity is paused.

@description

Setting allowBackground to true allows the audio to continue playing, for example, if the application is in the background.

@platform android 0.9
property.shortDoc:
Boolean to indicate if audio should continue playing even if the associated
Android Activity is paused. ...

property.name: apiName
property.doc:
The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to.

@description

The value of this property is the fully qualified name of the API. For example, Button returns Ti.UI.Button.

@platform android 3.2.0 @platform blackberry 3.2.0 @platform iphone 3.2.0 @platform ipad 3.2.0 @platform mobileweb 3.2.0
property.shortDoc: The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to. ...

property.name: bitRate
property.doc:
Bit rate of the current playback stream.

@platform iphone 0.9 @platform ipad 0.9
property.shortDoc: Bit rate of the current playback stream. ...

property.name: bubbleParent
property.doc:
Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent.

@description

Some proxies (most commonly views) have a relationship to other proxies, often established by the add() method. For example, for a button added to a window, a click event on the button would bubble up to the window. Other common parents are table sections to their rows, table views to their sections, and scrollable views to their views. Set this property to false to disable the bubbling to the proxy's parent.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0
property.shortDoc: Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent. ...

property.name: bufferSize
property.doc:
Size of the buffer used for streaming, in bytes.

@platform iphone 0.9 @platform ipad 0.9
property.shortDoc: Size of the buffer used for streaming, in bytes. ...

property.name: duration
property.doc:
Estimated duration in milliseconds of the file being played.

@description

May return 0 when playing a live stream.

@platform android 3.3.0 @platform iphone 3.3.0 @platform ipad 3.3.0
property.shortDoc: Estimated duration in milliseconds of the file being played. ...

property.name: idle
property.doc:
Boolean indicating if the player is idle.

@description

true if the player is in the initialized state: that is, not playing, paused, or waiting for data.

@platform iphone 0.9 @platform ipad 0.9
property.shortDoc: Boolean indicating if the player is idle. ...

property.name: lifecycleContainer
property.doc:
The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy.

@description

If this property is set to a Window or TabGroup, then the corresponding Activity lifecycle event callbacks will also be called on the proxy. Proxies that require the activity lifecycle will need this property set to the appropriate containing Window or TabGroup.

@platform android 3.6.0
property.shortDoc: The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy. ...

property.name: paused
property.doc: Boolean indicating if audio playback is paused.

property.name: playing
property.doc:
Boolean indicating if audio is currently playing.

@description

Returns false if playback is stopped or paused.
property.shortDoc: Boolean indicating if audio is currently playing. ...

property.name: progress
property.doc:
Current playback progress, in milliseconds.

@description

Returns zero if bitRate has not yet been detected.

@platform iphone 0.9 @platform ipad 0.9

property.name: state
property.doc:
Current state of playback, specified using one of the STATE constants defined on this object.

This API can be assigned the following constants:

  • STATE_BUFFERING
  • STATE_INITIALIZED
  • STATE_PAUSED
  • STATE_PLAYING
  • STATE_STARTING
  • STATE_STOPPED
  • STATE_STOPPING
  • STATE_WAITING_FOR_DATA
  • STATE_WAITING_FOR_QUEUE

@platform iphone 0.9 @platform ipad 0.9
property.shortDoc: Current state of playback, specified using one of the STATE constants defined on this object. ...

property.name: time
property.doc:
Current playback position of the audio.

@description

Time is reported in milliseconds.

@platform android 3.3.0
property.shortDoc: Current playback position of the audio. ...

property.name: url
property.doc: URL for the audio stream.

property.name: volume
property.doc:
Volume of the audio, from 0.0 (muted) to 1.0 (loudest).

@description

This setting controls the volume of the sound relative to the overall volume setting for the device.

On iOS, to adjust the volume of the device, set the volume property of Titanium.Media.appMusicPlayer and set the Titanium.Media.audioSessionMode property to either Titanium.Media.AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_AMBIENT, Titanium.Media.AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_SOLO_AMBIENT, or Titanium.Media.AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_PLAYBACK.

@platform android 2.1.0 @platform iphone 2.1.0 @platform ipad 2.1.0
property.shortDoc: Volume of the audio, from 0.0 (muted) to 1.0 (loudest). ...

property.name: waiting
property.doc:
Boolean indicating if the playback is waiting for audio data from the network.

@description

This property is true if the player is in any of the waiting states, including buffering, starting, waiting for data, and waiting for queue.

@platform iphone 0.9 @platform ipad 0.9
property.shortDoc: Boolean indicating if the playback is waiting for audio data from the network. ...

method.name: applyProperties
method.doc:
Applies the properties to the proxy.

@description

Properties are supplied as a dictionary. Each key-value pair in the object is applied to the proxy such that myproxy[key] = value.

params.name: props
params.doc:
A dictionary of properties to apply.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform blackberry 3.3.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0 @platform mobileweb 3.0.0

method.name: pause
method.doc:
Pauses audio playback.

@description

On iOS, the pause call operates as a toggle. If the stream is already paused, calling pause again resumes playing the stream.

On Android, the pause call does nothing if the stream is already paused.

On both platforms, calling start on a paused stream resumes play.
method.shortDoc: Pauses audio playback. ...

method.name: play
method.doc:
Starts or resumes audio playback.

@description

This method is identical to start.

@platform android 0.9
method.shortDoc: Starts or resumes audio playback. ...

method.name: release
method.doc:
Stops buffering audio data and releases audio resources.

@description

On Android, this method should be called when you are done streaming a given audio object, to release underlying resources, including buffered data.

@platform android 0.9
method.shortDoc: Stops buffering audio data and releases audio resources. ...

method.name: removeEventListener
method.doc:
Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event.

@description

Multiple listeners can be registered for the same event, so the callback parameter is used to determine which listener to remove.

When adding a listener, you must save a reference to the callback function in order to remove the listener later:

var listener = function() { Ti.API.info("Event listener called."); }
window.addEventListener('click', listener);

To remove the listener, pass in a reference to the callback function:

window.removeEventListener('click', listener);

params.name: name
params.doc: Name of the event.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to remove. Must be the same function passed to addEventListener.

method.shortDoc: Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event. ...

Converts a state value into a text description
suitable for display. ...

method.name: stop
method.doc: Stops audio playback.
method.shortDoc: Stops audio playback. ...

event.name: change
event.doc:
Fired when the state of the playback changes.

@description

This event can be generated by programmatic events, such as pausing or stopping the audio, and also by external events, such as the current state of network buffering.

params.name: state
params.doc:
Current state of playback.

This API can be assigned the following constants:

  • STATE_BUFFERING
  • STATE_INITIALIZED
  • STATE_PAUSED
  • STATE_PLAYING
  • STATE_STARTING
  • STATE_STOPPED
  • STATE_STOPPING
  • STATE_WAITING_FOR_DATA
  • STATE_WAITING_FOR_QUEUE

params.name: description
params.doc: Text description of the state of playback.

(android iphone ipad) source

Source object that fired the event.

(android iphone ipad) type

Name of the event fired.

(android iphone ipad) bubbles

True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

(android iphone ipad) cancelBubble

Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

event.shortDoc: Fired when the state of the playback changes. ...

event.name: complete
event.doc: Fired when the audio has finished playing.

params.name: success
params.doc: Indicates if the sound was played successfully. Returns true if request succeeded, false otherwise.

params.name: error
params.doc: Error message, if any returned. Will be undefined if success is true.

params.name: code
params.doc: Error code. Error code will be 0 if success is true, nonzero otherwise. If the error was generated by the operating system, that system's error value is used. Otherwise, this value will be -1.

(android iphone ipad) source

Source object that fired the event.

(android iphone ipad) type

Name of the event fired.

(android iphone ipad) bubbles

True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

(android iphone ipad) cancelBubble

Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

@platform android 0.9

event.shortDoc: Fired when the audio has finished playing. ...

event.name: progress
event.doc: Fired once per second with the current progress during playback.

params.name: progress
params.doc: Current progress, in milliseconds.

(android iphone ipad) source

Source object that fired the event.

(android iphone ipad) type

Name of the event fired.

(android iphone ipad) bubbles

True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

(android iphone ipad) cancelBubble

Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

event.shortDoc: Fired once per second with the current progress during playback. ...
